name: Acrobatics
description: Covers your ability to stay on your feet in tricky situations, such as when you're trying to run across a sheet of ice, balance on a tightrope, or stay upright on a rocking ship.
example: I want to try and run across the ice without falling.

name: Animal Handling
description: Measures your ability to calm a domesticated animal, keep a mount from getting spooked, or intuit an animal's intentions.
example: I want to try to calm down the spooked horse.

name: Arcana
description: Measures your ability to recall lore about spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, the planes of existence, and the inhabitants of those planes.
example: Do I recognize the magical runes carved into this door?

name: Athletics
description: Covers difficult situations you encounter while climbing, jumping, or swimming.
example: I attempt to climb the sheer cliff wall.

name: Deception
description: Determines whether you can convincingly hide the truth, either verbally or through your actions.
example: I tell the guard I'm just a merchant from out of town.

name: History
description: Measures your ability to recall lore about historical events, legendary people, ancient kingdoms, past disputes, recent wars, and lost civilizations.
example: Do I know the history of this ancient castle?

name: Insight
description: Decides whether you can determine the true intentions of a creature, such as searching out a lie or predicting someone's next move.
example: I watch his face closely to see if he is lying to us.

name: Intimidation
description: Used when you attempt to influence someone through overt threats, hostile actions, and physical violence.
example: I slam my fist on the table and demand answers.

name: Investigation
description: Used when you look around for clues and make deductions based on those clues.
example: I search the room for a hidden lever or secret door.

name: Medicine
description: Lets you try to stabilize a dying companion or diagnose an illness.
example: I check his wounds to see what kind of weapon caused them.

name: Nature
description: Measures your ability to recall lore about terrain, plants and animals, the weather, and natural cycles.
example: What kind of berries are these, and are they poisonous?

name: Perception
description: Lets you spot, hear, or otherwise detect the presence of something. It measures your general awareness of your surroundings and the keenness of your senses.
example: I listen at the door to hear if anyone is inside.

name: Performance
description: Determines how well you can delight an audience with music, dance, acting, storytelling, or some other form of entertainment.
example: I play a song on my lute to entertain the tavern crowd.

name: Persuasion
description: Used when you attempt to influence someone or a group of people with tact, social graces, or good nature.
example: I try to convince the king that our cause is just.

name: Religion
description: Measures your ability to recall lore about deities, rites and prayers, religious hierarchies, holy symbols, and the practices of secret cults.
example: Which god does this temple belong to?

name: Sleight of Hand
description: Used whenever you attempt an act of legerdemain or manual trickery, such as planting something on someone else or concealing an object on your person.
example: I try to pick the noble's pocket while bumping into him.

name: Stealth
description: Used when you attempt to conceal yourself from enemies, slink past guards, slip away without being noticed, or sneak up on someone without being seen or heard.
example: I try to move silently through the shadows behind the guards.

name: Survival
description: Used to follow tracks, hunt wild game, guide your group through frozen wastelands, identify signs that owlbears live nearby, predict the weather, or avoid quicksand.
example: I look for tracks to follow the goblin war party.
